content.detailedDescription: My daughter and i saw 9 lights orange/red brighter than star light going up in altitude than tracking down range. from our se but tracking to the south to south west - looked like missles - used to live south of ksc in florida - looked like rockets
content.summary: Orange/red lights gaining altitude and going down range

content.detailedDescription: At 3:30am pacific time my husband went to go smoke a cig. he then came hauling butt into the house and told me that i had to come see this. i got dressed and went outside to the back porch. he then showed me where it was. it was due west just above the tree line. there were lights on this that were red, blue and white. this looked like a star or planet. the lights werent flashing like an airplane. we watched it for about 3 mins and it was moving left and right up and down it then moved in a diagnal \ just like this icon up and down. it then moved in a full circle 4 times. we tried to get video and couldn't get any i did get audio of us watching this object. this went on for about 35 mins and then it decended behind the trees shot straight up and dropped like a brick in 30 seconds time. i have never seen an object move like this, and the star location was in between the first and second star of the start of the scropion's tail, from the butt about 100 yards from the tree line. no known object that i know of can move like this did. wishing we can see this again, with video or photos.
content.summary: Star like object with red and white and blue lights.

content.detailedDescription:
My friend and i were going on a motorcycle ride. i pull up to my friends house and look. i saw a very bright star that resembled the brightness of venus.  i was facing east south east. it continued on a north, north west trajectory. it was covering a huge portion of night sky very quickly.  the speed was like nothing i have ever seen before. i know something at the altitude cannot cover a whole hemisphere of night sky that quckickly unless it's a meteror comet or a hypersonic aircraft. as passed above my head it slowed down buy was still moving very quickly. a cloud was in the northern part of the sky.  it passed behind the cloud and never cane out the othe side. if i had to guesstimate the speed i would assume at that altitiude the craft must of been traveling at least mach 6 or 7. but i have never seen a craft move that fast so have no basis for comparison.   

i was thought it was just a meteor at first but when i saw slow down and doses ear behind a cloud i knew what it was.   also i thought it might of been a firework but the altitude of this object was far beyond even commercial fireworks in altitude. it really was that altitude the got my attention. a craft that resembles a star. must be high up. i 20 miles away from ohare international airport. i have seen a lot of high moving jets. i have never mistook a jet for a star. for it to be that high, bright, and moving at that speed was nothing short of amazing.
content.summary: Star like object moving at high speed across the night sky

content.detailedDescription: My son and i were in town getting a bag of ice from an ice vending machine in downtown steeleville. as i was collecting the bag of ice from the machine, my son opened the truck door and said, "mom, mom what's that?" traveling across the sky was an orange colored object. it continued in a straight line across the sky over our heads at a moderate rate of speed. at first, i thought it may have been a firework of some sort since it is the fourth of july weekend, but when the object was directly overhead, i realized it could not be a firework. it looked like it was on fire as it flew over, but it did not burn out. it also was not an airplane. there was also an airplane flying over in the eastern sky and the colors of the lights were totally different. (plane emitted a white light) my son(10) said he was watching the sky over some houses in front of him for fireworks when the object appeared from the horizon. this is when he alerted me to the object. after traveling in a straight line, as the object neared the opposite horizon from it's origin, it disappeared. we drove to the area where we saw it disappear, but saw no evidence of it at all. i have never seen anything like this in my life. it defied all my logical thinking of what it could be.
content.summary: Orange, fiery object rising from horizon, then moving across the night sky at a moderate rate of speed, then disappearing

content.detailedDescription: We are sitting in yard enjoying the night and fireworks when five bright red glowing lights in triangle format flying in sky above us. we were like what is that? is that a fire work? or those mexican larterns ?  but no. they traveled together like planes. then just disappeared. tried to video tape on phone only took 20 secs of recording.  but have tirangle shown.  very weird.
content.summary: Sitting in yard saw five bright lights in sky. not fireworks. traveling together high in sky in triangle formation. then just disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: My husband called me outside around 8:10 to look at an object that was very bright outside of our house, directly on the mountainside in front of us. i grabbed my video camera and started taping it and zooming in and out could not make out what it was. i kept taping it and he and i and a friend kept trying to get a really good look at it. our friend had binoculars and one second he would say it was two lights but in my video its only one. it looked almost like a flare, or gave off light and colors like a welder (minus sparks)but it was all glowing like the sun. occasionally it would go out but i could see an outline of something that looked like two dark circles in a rectangle box, which would give off a dim glow then grow bright orange again where the two dark circles were and make the big orange ball again. you can see energy all around it, too. mind you, this is on a mountain, not where a road goes(there are trails) but there no houses close by and there are only groves around it. you can see trees behind it in the video, it was still daylight when i started taping it, just starting to get dark outside. eventually it disappeared, then reappeared, then what i thought had disappeared for good. on part of the video you can see it reappear, then dim out to where you  see the outline  with the little black circulars in a rectangle and then "poof" disappeared,or rather just vanished. i went inside and was going to look at it on the tv and my husband called me back out and it was a shape of a diamond now, sort of twinkling like a star, and lifting off the ground. no blinking, no noise, but then it turned into different lights, which is hard to describe what they are. i wonder what it was, and anybody i've showed doesn't know and they're just as curious as me.I wasn't afraid of it and neither was my husband and our friend. i wanted to report it to see if anybody else saw what i did.
content.shape: Circle,   Diamond,   Fireball,   Sphere,   Square,   Rectagular
content.summary: Orange colored ball on mountainside

content.detailedDescription: Looking north, 1st bright orange light came s-e down over distant mountain. slow steady turn in e. direction, then up toward n.[ large arc ] 1st light before going out of sight made very fast wiggling decent, then up & gone. last two lights moved in same path, but no movement before going out of sight. watched through binoculars held firm against vehicle. whole incedent very similar to july 4th event of 2009. lights had form,but w/ clouds & distance, cannot make id.
content.summary: 3 orange lights north of wilkes- barre, pa. follow same path

content.detailedDescription:
It was either late november or early december 1988, and i was 16 years old.  i was riding on a school bus back from panama city, fl around 10:00-10:30 pm.  we had just defeated one of the best teams in the state at the time.  i was feeling very well and happy about my performance and continued to replay the game in my mind.  
about 30 minutes into our return trip home to tallahassee, our bus was crossing over open water on a bridge.  i looked around the bus and noticed that all of the players, coaches and cheerleaders seemed to be asleep.  the only person i could tell who was awake was the guy sitting next to me "dave".  
even though we played on the same team, "dave" and i rarely spoke because we were two different people internally.  so we sat next to each other quietly.  i looked out of the window out of sheer boredom and noticed a very bright, white light.  i turned to "dave", as i was the one seated by the window, and asked "dave is that venus or the north star."  he replied that he wasn't sure.  so i turned and looked back and thought to myself this star sure is bright.  all of a sudden without realizing it my eyes were set and transfixed on this star.  it was pulsing like a heartbeat.  i thought to myself that the stars must look different on this side of the state.  
after staring at this light for 1-2 minutes my brain went into an unconscous thought mode and all of a sudden a true grip of terror and primal fear ran all over my body right down to my bones.  and i tell you i had never been that scared in my entire life.  my thought was "jesus, if these guys wanted to take us out they could."  and then the light moved.
the light moved straight up, quickly about eight inches and stopped for 15-20 seconds.  it then moved diagonally southeast (45 degree angle)around six inches and again stopped for 15-20 seconds.  it moved again straight across over to the left around 12 inches and again stopped.  southest again it moved around six inches and it stopped.  it was just floating in the air, almost hovering a little up and down almost right on top of the water.  finally the pulsing light just shot straight backwards and was gone.  it reminded me of turning the television set off.   the little white light that remains at the end and then just disappears.
i turned back to my left at "dave" and asked "did you see that?"  dave's eyes were widely openned, like a deer in headlights, mouth closed and his head turning in a "no" mannerism back and forth.  he was in shock.  we just looked at each other, rolled opposite ways and went to sleep.  until that night i had never even thought about ufo's.
the very next morning as i was getting ready for school i had the radio turned on as usual listening to music.  then the morning news was being reported in-between songs.  and i heard it with my own ears; "76 people over in gulf county, florida reported seeing an unidentified flying object last night."  "thank god"  was all i thought to myself.  somebody else, somewhere else, saw the exact same pulsing light as i did.
later that day we had practice and before practice i approached "dave" and asked if he remembered what he saw that night before.  he said "yeah, i do, but i don't want to talk about it anymore."  
thirteen years later "dave" and i crossed paths again in our professions.  i was a basketball coach and he was a referee.  when we looked at each other there was not a drop of basketball in our eyes.  i asked him "do you remember?" and he just nodded his head up and down in a yes-ward motion."  we never spoke about that evening since.
even today i don't know if there are aliens or martians, but i am absolutely sure that there are unidentified flying objects.
content.summary: On a bus

content.detailedDescription: While at a cookout/party in portsmouth,ri, close to midnight th enight of july 1st, a little while (around a half hour) after a late plane flight out of the airport there flew overhead, i noticed a reddish orange flickering light similar to that given off by a road flare moving across the northwest quadrant of the sky from west to north just above the treeline, climbing slightly. it was moving slowly, taking perhaps a minute to cross a 45 degree arc of sky. it then seemed to shift course, coming closer to where we were gathered outdoors near the greendale vinyards. i called my friends attention to it at that point, trying to figure out what it was. all observed it as it seemed to come closer, then rise almost vertically out of sight. during the apparent ascent, it moved slightly further across the sky in a northeast direction. it was quiet; there were no sounds discernible over the crickets and the crackle of our cookfire, nor did those sounds nor other animal noises appear to stop during the event. noone present had a plausible guess although we did make several ufo jokes afterwards. i think overall the feeling was curiousity.
content.summary: Reddish-orange flare moving slowly, several direction changes

content.detailedDescription:
In the summer of 1974, in vna buren , arkansas.
i was playing football with my brother and 2 other friends. i was getting ready to throw the football and right there in front of me was a (ufo) about 60 feet off the ground and about 75 feet away. all four of us saw the object for about 30 seconds. it was moving north to south at a slow rate of speed. it was gray, rectangle, box shape with several colored lights around the top of the object. no windows or doors and it made no sound. it was about the size of a large armored vehicle or small school bus. i have never seen it before or since.

(this is a report submitted to the west central section of arkansas mufon and the witness who wishes to remain anonomous. this is being submitted by ssd race hobbs)
content.summary: Close range sighting of object in 1974

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were at hope creamery on branch ave. in providence, ri. i just happened to look up and noticed a strange orange light flying around. i thought that it may be a firework, since it is so close to the 4th. when it didn't go away i realized that it was some kind of object flying around. i showed my husband and he couldn't figure out what it was either. it was a bright orange light in a sphere shape. flying around with no distinct pattern. it would stop and then fly again. i heard no engine or anything. it was weird how it was silent. soon, a plane flew by and the object disappeared.  we both were very spooked and still cannot believe what we saw. there is no way the pilot (on the plane that flew by) could have not seen this object! it looked like a fire ball!
content.summary: Orange orb  floating around in sky

content.detailedDescription: At about 10:30 i looked out the doorway and saw what looked like a star that was flashing red and blue intermittently. upon closer inspection it seemed to be moving ever so slightly like a firefly. i called my roomate to look and as soon as she came it started releasing little white glowing orbs then two glowing objects shot accross the sky at high speed zig zagging along.They covered the entire sky in about 3 seconds the made an abrupt 90 degree turn without slowing down. also 3 balls of light formed a triangle then became one then dissappeared reappearing somewhere a short distance away.It almost looked like projectiles were being fired back and forth between different objects but they were too far away to tell for sure. this went on for hours before i went to bed at about 4 a.M.
content.summary: Starlike object flashing red blue and green moving in sky then shooting acroos the sky at high speed making sharp turns.

content.detailedDescription: July 1st friday around 1:00 in the afternoon i was driving with my two children north on 217 towards beaverton oregon. clear cloudless day. a silver object caught my eye, it was slightly different looking, so i kept watching it as i drove. i could see it in my vision at all times while driving. it did not appear to be moving from my vantage point. i did not see any planes on the area at the time. it was far away and high but close enough to see it glowing very brightly (i thought maybe it was the sun reflecting) but it was not moving. i asked my children what they thought it was. they also could not figure it out. it was not acting like a typical plane. we all watched it for about 20 seconds and it just disappeared. not took off or moved but vanished. my only thought would be a balloon, if it had been a huge one? but it was not round it was oval shaped. hoping others saw this too?
content.summary: Silver object north in the sky, did not move was stationary, glowed brightly then disappeared/vanished. watched for about 20 sec total.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting down beneath an event canopy. the temperature was in the high 80's and lighting conditions were very sunny. i had a view of the sky from the horizon to about 120 feet high before the canopy blocked my view. 

once or twice i noticed commercial airliners on their way to or from the international airport in sj.

but later and saw an object that i at first that might be a weather balloon.
it ascended above the canopy so i had to stand up and get a better look. the sun was directly above me and behind me head so i had to make a sun shade with my hands to get a clear view. 

it was so small that it took my maybe 10 seconds to find it again. at this point it was much higher in the sky. it seemed to move very slowly. the size of the object relative to my perspective would be about the size of a tack if held up in my hand and pointed at the sky.

there was another person with my who was not able to see it even though i pointed directly at it.

i kept watching it to see if i could rule out whether it was a plane or other kind of aircraft. one of the difficulties of examining it's outline were occasional reflections from what i at the time assumed was the sun. 

i had to really focus on it to try and make out what it was. for example, if the object was above 30,000 feet, than that could explain it's slow movement relative to the ground.  

the color of the object was a dull brown to red. no metallic composition as far as i could see. since it was not metallic, i didn't understand how it could reflect the sun. i figured what i was seeing was it's nearest edge wobbling up and down towards me as it moved. then this edge must be reflective. i thought.

but then i noticed an usual behavior which in my opinion is against the law of physics. it reflected very bright sunlight several times even though the angle of the object did not suggest this was possible.

for instance, if you move a mirror back and forth, it will reflect sunlight. this object was reflecting sunlight without moving back and forth.

after watching it for some time i must conclude it's real altitude was somewhere between 500 and 2000 feet. dimension perhaps 20 feet in diameter.

it's trajectory was continually south to south-west even though position in the sky and altitude varied during the encounter.

it was so small i gave up watching after about 4 minutes. no one else believed that it was there.
content.summary: Unidentified flying object displaying unusual properties.

content.detailedDescription: Well i got a call from my dad at 10 pm last night july 1st, saying "your not going to believe this, but me and the neighbors just saw a ufo." this struck me as odd because my dad is the biggest skeptic ever and for him to call me out of the blue and tell me he saw something was crazy. anyways i talked to him and his friend both who witnessed it (middle aged men, who again denied anything like that was possible), and they both described an amber colored orb floating through the sky coming east over hermitage flying right over the house that zig zagged direction, stopped hovered, zig zaged again, hovered once more, and then took off straight into the air completely out of sight. they watched this for a little over a minute, but agree its very possible it could of been in the sky longer without them noticing (considering they were outside talking). it made no sound and flew much lower then a plane, and remained a bright amber color without any blinking or pulsating lights. it was a very clear night too so i know they saw something, and it turned middle aged skeptics into believing they saw something they could not explain..Decided to post this today after my dad called curious if other people saw it or reported it too.
content.summary: Silent low amber colored starlike orb

content.detailedDescription:
Walking the cypress creek hike & bike trail - birdwatching.  noticed a bright, glowing object moving at a very high altitude, going the wrong direction to be in the jet stream.  moving fast.  

i had a long zoom lens on the camera i was carrying and got several photos of the object.  i posted it on facebook and flickr with a remark and then one of my flickr contacts said something about the london sightings during the week.  i watched a couple of the youtube videos and the one of the closeup is remarkably like my still of the round side of the object.

mind you, i would've jokingly called this a ufo until i saw those 2 videos of the london sighting.

here's a link to my photo on flickr.  [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]

here's a link to the youtube video and if the center isn't remarably similar then tell me why it's not.
[link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg] 

what did i think...  husband was there too.  we were fascinated.  in this day and age no one really cares.  it's interesting.  we lost sight of it when it moved out of range of sight.  it couldn't have lasted much more than a minute or two at the most.  wouldn't we all like to think it's possible that intelligent life exists somewhere?

i can be contacted through my email
content.summary: Bright, glowing dot in the sky moving to the nnw.  zoomed in with a fairly powerful lens.  captured several shots.

content.detailedDescription: Last night at clement park we were waiting on fireworks display when in the sky an electric blue colored thing was moving in the sky and heading for the clouds and once it moved into the clouds you can still see the thing illuminate and then it came back out of the sky and stood over us but at a far distance for about a minute and then began shooting up it dissapeared. and fifteen minutes later it came back right in the middle of fireworks going off it did the exact same thing and headed back in the same direction.
content.summary: Blue light in the sky

content.detailedDescription: i was sitting in my garage looking out to the west to watch sunset, when from the west came a large black sphere with no reflection on surface of object  it preceded from the  west to east then  it stopped and made 90 degree turn to the north  about the same speed as a jet, there was no reflection of any kind of light on the sphere , but if you put together  five jets   at that height this black sphere would have been the size of 5 jets in diameter ! . as i am close to the indianapolis airport i thought it was a airplane but it had no lights at all , said objects altitude was in between a jet landing and high altitude airplanes. i then called brownsburg police department and no one called in on said object i was very surprised ! could not contact the airport control tower. i also had the strange feeling that it was talking to me , that we are going to meet again soon ? something about transfer of information .
content.summary: Large black sphere

content.detailedDescription: I was outside lighting fireworks. i looked up at the sky as i often do because i like looking at the stars. i saw an object that looked like a star flying across the sky. it did kind of a wide turn then faded out and was gone. at the time i though it may be an airplane but i saw no blinking red lights. but then again airplanes don't just disappear do they?
content.summary: Blue/white star like object

content.detailedDescription:
At about 11:35 i put the dog out. i happened to look at the sky, and observed a bright reddish-orange light crossing the sky in a straight line, approximately se to nw. i initially took it to be the landing light of an airliner, due to its size and the fact that this is a common flight path for planes arriving at pittsburgh international airport. however, the color was wrong for a landing light. in addition, there were no blinking lights anywhere in the vicinity of this light, as would be found on a plane's tail and wingtips. i also did not hear any noise at all, as i would have expected from a jet flying overhead.

the light progressed across the sky at a fairly slow pace. it passed overhead perhaps 30-45 seconds after i first noticed it. as it did so, the light faded out. there was a faint dark shape that continued in the trajectory of the light until the glare from pittsburgh hid it. the impression was similar to a vehicle with a headlight and no taillights passing by. the shape was faint enough that i cannot describe it with certainty - perhaps triangular or rectangular? in the sky it was perhaps the size of my thumbnail when held at arm's length.

a check of nasa's skysearch found no satellites passing over the mckeesport area between 11:00 and 12:00 this evening. after retrieving my camcorder, i sat outside and observed the sky until 12:30, but did not see anything besides the usual jets passing overhead.

i am a pastor in my mid-thirties, with a bachelor's and master's degree. this is the first time i have observed an object in the sky that i could not explain. my primary emotional response was one of curiosity - i wonder whether anyone else will report this.
content.summary: Bright reddish-orange light moving from se to nw toward pittsburgh

content.detailedDescription:
Wed evening, 06/29/11, i went out back of my house to have a cigarette around 10pm.  as i live approx 15 miles from phila intl airport, i scanned the sky to see what was moving.  i immediately saw a plane heading west, obviously just departing as it was rather low & loud. it passed over my property & the sound diminished, then i saw another plane at very high altitude heading ene.  no sound could be heard it clearly had blinking strobes.  at that time i saw another light come from behind me, moving south.  it caught my attention because there were no strobes at all.  i'm not good at judging altitudes, but i would guess 2500ft.  i watched it as it headed south, waiting to see if i could hear any sound as it progressed.  i live in a very quiet, rural suburb and if this object had made a noise i would definitely have heard it at the altitude it was, but there was no noise from it that i could hear.  i watched it moving rather slowly across the sky until all of a sudden it just blinked out.  i was surprised and thought that maybe it had gone behind a cloud (even though i was pretty sure it was well beneath any clouds), but i watched for another 5 minutes and i never saw it again.
the object was a low, glowing object.  i couldn't see if there was any shape to it.  it moved smoothly and slowly from north to south, towards nj, south of phila intl.  the object did not fade away into the distance but rather just turned off in mid flight.   the whole event took maybe 2 minutes from first sight to whenit disappeared.
content.summary: Slow & steady, white light moving north to south. no blinking, no sound.

content.detailedDescription: 2 nights ago around 10:30 i went out back for a smoke when i was looking at the planes flying over a bright light caught my eye. it was going west to east tword new jersey accross the normal flight paths for planes around here. it was like a star but much brighter. i watched it go slow and steady all the way across the sky, then as it got over jersey it dimmed and vanished. earlier tonight i was telling my wife about it and went out back for a smoke around 10:30 pm and saw it again! i was watching a plane going to philly airport when my eye was caught by a moving star to the right. it then flaired up to the exact same brightness from 2 nights ago, and it wasn't a question i instantly new it was the same thing, then dimmed out and vanished right before my eyes.
content.summary: Saw moving star, flaired up bright then dimmed out until it vanished

content.detailedDescription:
It began by me looking out of my living room window and seeing a squadrant of 3 lights flying over the house. i walked outside with my camera. nothing happened so i went inside and again saw lights. this time upon closer inspection i captured a triangle on film. after the triangle seemingly disappeared over the tree line i sat outside and waited. soon i saw a flashing orb with 2 white and one red light flying over i observed said object for about 4 minutes until it faded over the river. (i live on the chicahominy river) i acquired an overwhelming feeling of excitement and anxiety and as noted on the tape i cursed many times.

i do not want this to be exposed to the media!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: One triangle captured on film flying silently and one pulsating light captured

content.detailedDescription: I was outside with my son setting up our telescope tonight when i saw a very bright star moving.  at first i thought it might be an asteroid since i heard we were supposed to have a close encounter with one this week.  well i yelled for my brother to come out and we just watched it in amazment until it disapeared.  it looked like a very bright start and traveled maybe the speed of a jet or slowed did no change directions at all.  so afterwards i came inside and googled what it would have been and i saw two people in pennslyvania(where i am)saw the same thing last night.  well if it's back tomorro i will be sitting out there with my video recorder.  it was the most amazing and cool thing any of us has seen.  it's been over an hour ago and i still can't beleive it.  i just wish i had it on camera, at least it's something me and my boy can remember for the rest of our lives.
content.summary: Very bright white starlike object moving slowly southeast in a straight line

content.detailedDescription:
I was near circle lake in minnesota when i saw the object. i was looking north and, unknown distance away, saw a pulsating fireball stationary just above the horizon. it looked kind of like emergency lights would look from a distance, if they could hover above horizon. the light was mostly white with a pulsating red tint. it looked quite different than an airplane, and was far lower in the sky than most aircraft fly. 

the object disappeared behind the trees and traveled a few degrees to the east, looking like it was above interstate 35. same pulsating fireball / sparking look. no sound.

this was just after a thunderstorm passed and the air was still and quiet. the sun was not out, so i don't think it would have been reflections off metal. i thought it might be fireworks, but it had just poured rain with strong winds so i doubt anyone was out. and i never heard any crackles or booms. plus, the object hung in the sky for a few minutes motionless before it, i guess, apparently moved or reappeared some distance away to the east. it disappeared after a minute or two. it didn't move like fireworks move, either. it was much more deliberate and steady in its motion.

i don't know why i noticed it. i just happened to glance between the trees and saw an object in the sky where there usually isn't anything at all. 

my wife saw it too. she was standing next to me.
content.summary: Pulsating object above tree line

content.detailedDescription: My friends and i were driving down valley blvd back to cal poly pomona from having a late night dinner. i randomly looked out the window and up (for some strange reason) and saw this strange orange ball of light, not too far up from us. i stared at it for a good 15 seconds, trying to cancel out all the possibilities. at first i thought, "oh, maybe it's one of those chinese lanterns or a blimp." i kept looking at it, trying to figure it out. i told my friends, "you guys, look, it's a ufo." no one believed me. we stopped at a red light on the intersection of valley and temple when i told my friends just to look at it. they both looked up at it. we were all baffled. none of us knew what it was. my friend made the left turn at the intersection and i quickly turned around to stare at it through the back window. i kept trying to determine what it could possibly be. my eyes were glued to it. all of a sudden, i'm looking at it, and it slowly begins to hover toward the direction we were going. the further we would drive down temple, the closer (in distance, not altitude) it would come towards us. when i told my friends that i had a feeling "it" knew i was watching and that it was following us, they began to freak out. we made a right onto kellogg and ended up at another red light where a police officer happened to be in the lane next to us. we yelled at him, asking him to pull over with us and ask him what it was. we all pulled over and watched it over. it was about 1,000 feet up and a quarter mile away, not too far at all. the bright orange fire ball stayed in that spot, motionless for about a minute as we all stared up at it. after, it began hovering in a figure 8 motion for a minute. it then started dimming and brightening in intervals of about 2 seconds. all of a sudden, it completely darkened. we couldn't see anything--but in the spot where it was, tiny little "fire balls" began falling from the sky. it then appeared a little lighter than the sky, so it was barely visible, continued to drop these little orange fireballs (which also disappeared after dropping about 20 feet).  the police officer then called his partner to come check it out since he had no clue what it was. we all sat watching it in awe. at first, i felt protected, it was strange. i felt like it was trying to tell me something. i didn't become fearful until i felt like it was following us. i had no clue what was going to happen. we lost sight of it when it moved behind some tree. we were able to see it for another 30 seconds then disappeared. we haven't seen it since.
content.summary: Orange ball of light

content.detailedDescription: I had just got home from picking my wife up from work. i had forgot my cell phone in the car. when i retrieved the phone a bright pulsating light caught my eye. the object was to the north and appeared to object heading north east. the object was moving erraticly and extremely slow! it would move up, down, left, and right in no particular pattern that i could tell and even pausing was times. i sat and watchd the object until the light from the sunrise and direction it was headed made it impossible to see with the naked eye. this was around 5:50. i had witnessed two identical object the night before around 3 a.M. the second object was near the same place this object was the following day. both sightings made my hair stand on end, and gave me goosebumps.
content.summary: Circular object pulsating red, green, blue, and yellow lights.

content.detailedDescription:
The object was chevron shaped, with a gray/transluance color, like heat waves coming off the road. it was about 1500 ft up following us-125 sw toward interstate i-275.   i followed the object for about 3 miles, when it made a right turn and turned the point of the chevron up.  the object then shot upward at a very fast speed and went into the clouds and i never saw it again.

the next day june 29, 2011, at 12:30 pm. i was going to lowe's down us-125 in the same direction as the object the day before, and there was 2 doe vans with dark out windows and flashing yellow lights on top.  they were going about 25 mph in the same direction as the object yesterday, and the lead van had a long bar across top of it just behind the driver and passenger doors.  on the top side of the bar at each end was a small white ball about the size of a softball with a flat bottom.  there was a metal plate under the bar and there must have been a lot of equipment in the vans due to the way there tires were looking.  the drivers of both van had green coveralls on and some kind of blue vest like you would see an x-ray tech use.

i followed the vans for a mile and had a white doe car pull in front and stop me.   the driver got out and told me to stop following them or i could be arrested and to go about my business.

i don't know if all this is connected, maybe you guys have seen this before.
content.summary: Chevron shape moving 50 mph sw over us125 made right angle turn stood on end and shot up at very fast speed

content.detailedDescription:
on march 11,2011 i went to my bedroom to smoke a cigarette. as i lit my cigarette i looked out my bedroom window (the blinds were up) and i saw four amber balls of light in a diamond shape drifting across the sky.I called my husband to see it and as we watched these lights they proceeded to change shape to a triangle type shape. so i ran for the video camera. i recorded the last part of the first "wave" and all of the 2nd wave & 2 pictures of the 3rd.
     the 2nd wave were 6 lights 2 in front and 4 following behind. they wern't very fast & seemed to float across the sky. what are they i don't know. i'm not very technical so i played the tape thru the t.V. and recorded it to my digatal camera. after the 2nd wave i was not expecting a 3rd wave to come by. the 3rd wave was about 8-10 of these balls of light in 2 strange formations. i tried to take pic's of these formations but they wouldn't show up on several pic's,however i do have 2 pic's that show a single ball of light in the lower right of the stills.
  sorry for the language in the video,we were shocked!
content.summary: Amber balls of light

content.detailedDescription: This was amazing last night ,i was fishing,by myself,in warren,on alleghany river,across,just down from the refinery,at 9;17pm,i looked up,above the refinery,to the e,and i thought i saw what was the 1st star coming out last night,it was a awesome clear,star lit night last night,well,i watched this star a couple min,then it started to move slowly to the e,this shocked my,so,as i always do i flashed them the cross sign,whoever is flyin this ufo,with my led flashlight,to let them know i see them,the ufo,moved very slowly to the e ,in about 2 min it acclelerated fast and was gone,well five min later,i see a ufo appear  above me,out of nowwhere and vanish,it was goin s to n,this was only like 10 secs,im startin to think,i wonder,if these ufo's r watchin me fish,well,at 9;30,its just startin to get dark,it was not  total dark til 10;30,my view,is lookin  to the n,from the  s bank,i notice at 9;30,above me to ne,2 stars that look like they r coming out,i watched these for couple min,then the star on the right started to move slowly to the right,this amazed me that i saw another ufo,almost above me hovering,id say,about 1000ft,on other side of river above refinery,i pulled out my light,and gave them my cross -/flash sign,abt 30 sec later the star on the left started to move slowly to the rt also,then,came down fast towards me,it gained in size and brightness all of a sudden,about 5 times what it was,this gave me butterflies in my stomach,im thinkin ,they see me,,they flashed me back with their ship,and their  comin down,!Right then,it dimmed a bit slowed down,went back up to the right slowly.Following his other ufo,buddy,and abt 30 sec later,going to the se they vanished,in 10 min a saw,3-4 other ufo's,come out of nowhere,in the same area,goin,se to n,and n to se,as if they were,watching me fish,also,at 9;35,i caught a nice 14 inch catfish,right after the ufo,what i think ,flashed me back,as i flashed him with my light,it was wierd,i counted about,10-12 ufo's,,i was hard to keep count,i was seein so many,from,9;15 to 11;30,cause,i saw a few,more,fling over warren,after the 1st seven,the last 5 were real high,goin,ne to sw,and s to n,these were all stars that looked to be moving,they were not shooting stars.,or planes,cause,i did see,abt,2-3 dozen planes also,flyin across,the sky,so these,ufo's,had to be seen by pilots,and radar,so in all i saw 4 ufo's hovering above me that started to move as if ,watchin me fish,and 1 of them,flashed me back with their ship,when they made it glow up bright when it started to come down towards me,this to me was very cool,its supposed to be cloudy tnight,dont know if i will see any,well thats my report, have  a great 4th july...
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I saw 10-12 ufo's on river fishing,from 9;15-11;30pm
